  • Method Details

    • getWalletView

      public PanelView getWalletView() throws UpdatingModelFailed
      Returns an updated, filtered wallet view where you can check the spendings of the signed in user.
      Returns:
      the updated version of the wallet view
      Throws:
      UpdatingModelFailed - if model of the view could not update

    • getChangeMoneyView

      public FrameView getChangeMoneyView()
      Returns a ChangeMoneyView where you can add or remove money to your wallet
      Returns:
      a ChangeWalletView

    • getSetMoneyView

      public FrameView getSetMoneyView()
      Returns a SetMoneyView where you can set to an exact amount of money on the account
      Returns:
      a SetMoneyView

    • refreshWalletView

      public void refreshWalletView() throws UpdatingModelFailed
      Throws:
      UpdatingModelFailed

    • changeMoneyOnAccount

      public void changeMoneyOnAccount(LocalDate date, String amountString, Currency currency, String reason) throws InvalidReasonException, CreatingRecordFailed, InvalidAmountException
      Adds or removes money on the account by adding a cashflow record. Automatically saves the changes to the save file
      Parameters:
      date - Date of the change
      amountString - amount of change (must be parsable to double)
      currency - currency of change
      reason - reason of the change (e.g. salary, found money on the street, etc.)
      Throws:
      InvalidReasonException - if reason is blank or null
      CreatingRecordFailed - if creating cashflow failed due to an IO Error
      InvalidAmountException - if amount is blank or can't be parsed to a double

    • addNewCashFlow

      public CashFlow addNewCashFlow(User user, LocalDate date, double amount, Currency currency, String reason) throws InvalidReasonException, CreatingRecordFailed
      Adds a new CashFlow record to a user and returns the ashflow istance created.
      Parameters:
      user - the user the cashflow belongs to
      date - date of the record
      amount - amount of the money for the record
      currency - currency of the money for the record
      reason - reason of the change (e.g. salary, found money on the street, etc.)
      Returns:
      the cashflow created
      Throws:
      InvalidReasonException - if reason is blank or null
      CreatingRecordFailed - if creating cashflow failed due to an IO Error

    • setMoneyOnAccount

      public void setMoneyOnAccount(String newAmountString, Currency currency, String reason) throws InvalidAmountException, CreatingRecordFailed, InvalidReasonException
      Sets the money on the account to an excact amount by creating a new CashFlow record with today's date.
      Parameters:
      newAmountString - amount of money on the account should have after the process
      currency - new currency of money
      reason - reason of change
      Throws:
      InvalidAmountException - if the amount is blank or can't be parsed to a double
      CreatingRecordFailed - if creating cashflow failed due to an IO Error
      InvalidReasonException - if the reason is blank or null

    • deleteCashFlow

      public void deleteCashFlow(CashFlow cashFlow) throws DeletingRecordFailed
      Removes a cashflow record from the save file.
      Parameters:
      cashFlow - the cashflow that should be removed
      Throws:
      DeletingRecordFailed - if deleting failed due to an IO Error

    • editCashFlow

      public void editCashFlow(CashFlow cashFlow, Money money, String reason, LocalDate date) throws EditingRecordFailed
      Changes the parameters of a cashflow.
      Parameters:
      cashFlow - the cashflow that should be cahnged
      money - the new money amount
      reason - the new reason of the cashflow
      date - the new date of the cashflow
      Throws:
      EditingRecordFailed - if editing failed due to an IO Error

    • getMoneyOnAccount

      private Money getMoneyOnAccount() throws SerializerCannotRead
      Reads the current amount of money on the account from the save file.
      Returns:
      the amount of money on the save file
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if the save file had issue while reading

    • filterFor

      public void filterFor(String yearString, Month month, CashFlowController.CashFlowType type) throws InvalidYearFormatException, UpdatingModelFailed
      Updates the models for a specified year, month and a cashflow type
      Parameters:
      yearString - the string value of a year (must be parsable into a year)
      month - the month we want to filter for
      type - ALL - if don't want to filter for type. INCOME - if you want to filter for only the incomes. EXPENSE - if you want to filter for only the expenses.
      Throws:
      InvalidYearFormatException - if the yearString can't be parsed to an int value
      UpdatingModelFailed - if the model could not update

    • updateModels

      private void updateModels(int year, Month month, CashFlowController.CashFlowType type) throws UpdatingModelFailed
      Updates the CashflowTableModel and the SummarizedCashFlowModel of the controller by creating new instances of them.
      Parameters:
      year - the CashFlowModel will only contain those records where the years match
      month - the CashFlowModel will only contain those records where the month match
      type - the CashFlowModel will only contain those records where the cashflow types match
      Throws:
      UpdatingModelFailed

    • parseYear

      private int parseYear(String yearString) throws InvalidYearFormatException
      Tries to parse a string to a possible year value
      Parameters:
      yearString - the string you want to parse to a year
      Returns:
      an int value that matches the year
      Throws:
      InvalidYearFormatException - if the yearString is not a number, blank or in the wrong format

    • reasonIsInvalid

      private boolean reasonIsInvalid(String reason)
      Checks if a reason is valid or not.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason you want to check
      Returns:
      TRUE - if reason is null or blank. FALSE - if reason is not null and is not blank

    • getAllCashFlows

      public List<CashFlow> getAllCashFlows() throws SerializerCannotRead
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead
